head.supplied: Melbourne botan. Garden, ¶ Easterday 67. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In compliance with your request I have the honor to furnish herewith a return of the copies still available in this establishment of the Fragmenta p...

div.p: 67/5646, unit 98, VPRS 44 inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In compliance with your request I have the honor to furnish herewith a return of the copies still available in this establishment of the Fragmenta phytographiae Australiae published from the beginning of 1858 til the end of 1866.
Unbound fascicles at the office of the Director of the botanic Garden one thousand seven hundreds eighty four 1784.
Unbound plates three thousand five hundred fourty nine 3549.

In further explanation I beg to append a letter of which a copy was adressed to you on the fourth of this month,
See M to J. McCulloch, 4 April 1867. and in addition I have still to observe, that unbound fascicles and plates have since the publication of the work been distributed by consent of Government as occasion arose for furthering the increase of the collections of the phytologic Museum by transmitting the prints to discoverers of certain plants, or to contributors to the herbarium, or to excite the aid of residents in localities rich in plants, or to afford information connected with the Australian vegetation.
